Aggressive behavior.question: Due to the physiological effects of a substance (including medications)

yes.question: Associated with a disturbance in attention and awareness characterized by a fluctuating course
yes.yes: DELIRIUM; SUBSTANCE WITHDRAWAL DELIRIUM; MEDICATION-INDUCED DELIRIUM (3.16.1)

no.question: Associated with evidence of decline in one or more of the following cognitive domains: complex attention, executive function, learning and memory, language, perceptual-motor, or social cognition
no.yes: SUBSTANCE/MEDICATION-INDUCED MAJOR or MILD NEUROCOGNITIVE DISORDER (3.16.2), WITH BEHAVIORAL DISTURBANCE
no.no: SUBSTANCE INTOXICATION; SUBSTANCE WITHDRAWAL; OTHER ADVERSE EFFECT OF MEDICATION

no.question: Due to the physiological effects of a general medical condition

yes.question: Associated with a disturbance in attention and awareness characterized by a fluctuating course
yes.yes: DELIRIUM DUE TO ANOTHER MEDICAL CONDITION (3.16.1)

no.question: Associated with evidence of decline in one or more of the following cognitive domains: complex attention, executive function, learning and memory, language, perceptual-motor, or social cognition
no.yes: MAJOR or MILD NEUROCOGNITIVE DISORDER DUE TO ANOTHER MEDICAL CONDITION (3.16.2), WITH BEHAVIORAL DISTURBANCE

no.question: Occurring in a pattern representing a change from previous personality pattern
no.yes: PERSONALITY CHANGE DUE TO ANOTHER MEDICAL CONDITION (3.17.11), AGGRESSIVE TYPE

no.question: Occurring in the context of a delusion or hallucination
no.yes: Psychotic Disorder (e.g., SCHIZOPHRENIA [3.2.1]). See Delusions Tree (2.5) or Hallucinations Tree (2.6) for differential diagnosis

no.question: Agitation associated with at least two characteristic symptoms of catatonia (e.g., catalepsy, waxy flexibility, negativism, posturing, stereotypy, echolalia)
no.yes: Catatonia (see Catatonic Symptoms Tree [2.7] for differential diagnosis)

no.question: Occurring in the context of elevated mood
no.yes: MANIC EPISODE in BIPOLAR I DISORDER (3.3.1) or SCHIZOAFFECTIVE DISORDER (3.2.2)

no.question: Occurring as part of a pattern of violation of the basic rights of others and age-appropriate social norms
Occurring as part of a persistent personality disturbance characterized by angry outbursts, mood dysregulation, and identity disturbance
Occurring in the context of severe temper outbursts that are grossly out of proportion to the situation accompanied by persistent anger and irritability between outbursts
Occurring in association with a pattern of argumentativeness defiance, and vindictiveness
Occurring in association with persistent symptoms of hyperactivity, impulsivity, and inattention

yes.question: Occurring in at least two different situations and causing clinically significant impairment, with several symptoms present before age 12

no.question: Occurring in reaction to attempts to separate the individual from major attachment figures
Occurring in association with persistent deficits in social communication and social interaction, accompanied by restricted repetitive patterns of behaviors, interests, or activities
Occurring in association with deficits in intellectual function, with accompanying deficits in adaptive functioning and onset during the developmental period
Occurring in the context of episodes of aggressive behavior that are grossly out of proportion to the situation
Occurring in the context of a symptomatic response to a psychosocial stressor

yes.question: Stressor is of an extremely traumatic nature (e.g., life-threatening situation) and there is recurrent reexperiencing of the trauma
yes.yes: POSTTRAUMATIC STRESS DISORDER or ACUTE STRESS DISORDER (3.7.1)

no.question: Clinically significant aggressive behavior not covered above that is indicative of a psychological dysfunction in the individual
no.yes: UNSPECIFIED DISRUPTIVE, IMPULSE-CONTROL, AND CONDUCT DISORDER
